contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Tytsjerksteradiel | native_name = ''Tietjerksteradeel'' | image_flag = Tytsjerksteradiel flag.svg | flag_size = 120x100px | flag_alt = Flag of Tytsjerksteradiel | image_seal = | seal_size = |image_skyline = Church Jistrum.jpg |image_caption= The church of [[Jistrum]], build in the 13th century | seal_alt = | image_shield = Coat of arms of Tietjerksteradeel.svg | shield_size = 120x100px | shield_alt = Coat of arms of Tytsjerksteradiel |image_map = LocatieTytsjerksteradiel.png |mapsize = 250px |coordinates_display = inline,title |coordinates_region = NL |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = [[Netherlands]] |subdivision_type1 = Province |subdivision_name1 = [[Friesland]] |area_footnotes = (2006) |area_total_km2 = 161.42 |area_land_km2 = 149.67 |area_water_km2 = 11.75 |population_as_of = 1 January, 2007 |population_note = Source: [[Statistics Netherlands|CBS]], [http://statline.cbs.nl/ Statline]. |settlement_type = Municipality |population_total = 32352 |population_density_km2 = 216 |timezone = [[Central European Time|CET]] |utc_offset = +1 |timezone_DST = [[Central European Summer Time|CEST]] |utc_offset_DST = +2 |latd = 53 |latm = 12 |latNS = N |longd = 6 |longm = 0 |longEW = E }} [[File:Molen De Hoop Sumar.jpg|thumb|200px| Gristmill ‘De Hoop’ in [[Sumar (Netherlands)|Sumar]], built in 1882.]] [[File:Pauluskerk van Oudkerk.jpg|thumb|200px|The church of [[Aldtsjerk]] (12th century).]] '''Tytsjerksteradiel''' ({{lang-nl|Tietjerksteradeel}}) is a [[municipality]] in the [[province]] of [[Friesland]] in the [[Netherlands]]. It is named after the town of Tytsjerk, whose name is derived from a person named Tiete. Tiete was a daughter of Tryn, after whom the region (Trynwâlden) is named. The other villages in Trynwâlden are also named after Tryn's children: Oentsjerk (Oene), Gytsjerk (Giete), Readtsjerk (Reade), Aldtsjerk (Âlde), Ryptsjerk (Rype). A statue of Tryn and her children is placed in Oentsjerk next to the mainroad (Rengerswei). Tsjerk is the [[West Frisian language|West Frisian]] word for [[church (building)|Church]]. Until 1989 the official name of the municipality was '''Tietjerksteradeel''' ({{Pronunciation|466 Tietjerksteradeel.ogg}}), the [[Dutch language|Dutch]] name; the current official name is West Frisian. The largest village in the municipality is Burgum. == Population centers == * [[Aldtsjerk]] ({{lang-nl|Oudkerk}}) * [[Bartlehiem]] * [[Burgum]] (Bergum) * [[Earnewâld]] (Eernewoude) * [[Eastermar]] (Oostermeer) * [[Garyp]] (Garijp) * [[Gytsjerk]] (Giekerk) * [[Hurdegaryp]] (Hardegarijp) * [[Jistrum]] (Eestrum) * [[Mûnein]] (Moleneind) * [[Noardburgum]] (Noordbergum) * [[Oentsjerk (Netherlands)|Oentsjerk]] (Oenkerk) * [[Ryptsjerk]] (Rijperkerk) * [[Sumar (Netherlands)|Sumar]] (Suameer) * [[Suwâld]] (Suawoude) * [[Tytsjerk]] (Tietjerk) * [[Wyns]] (Wijns) ===Hamlets=== * [[Gytsjerksterhoeke]] (Giekerkerhoek) * [[Iniaheide]] * [[It Heechsân]] (Hoogzand) * [[De Lytse Geast]] (Kleinegeest) * [[Quatrebras (Friesland)|Quatrebras]] * [[Skûlenboarch]] (Schuilenburg) * [[Sigerswâld]] (Siegerswoude) * [[Sumarreheide]] (Suameerderheide) * [[Feanwâldsterwâl (Tytsjerksteradiel)|Feanwâldsterwâl]] (Veenwoudsterwal) * [[It Wytfean]] (Witveen) * [[Zwartewegsend]] (Zwartewegsend) * [[Zevenhuizen (Tytsjerksteradiel)|Zevenhuizen]] == Main sights == * [[Protestant church of Wyns|Wyns]], [[Protestant church of Aldtsjerk|Aldtsjerk]], [[Protestant church of Jistrum|Jistrum]], [[Protestant church of Eastermar|Eastermar]], [[Protestant church of Oentsjerk|Oentsjerk]], [[Protestant church of Burgum|Burgum]] and [[Protestant church of Gytsjerk|Gytsjerk]] are home to medieval churches *The villages [[De Ouderkerkermolen, Aldtsjerk|Aldtsjerk]], [[De Princehofmolen, Earnewâld|Earnewâld]], [[Ypey Mole, Ryptsjerk|Ryptsjerk]], [[De Hoop, Sumar|Sumar]], Tytsjerk <small>([[De Lytse Geast, Tytsjerk|De Lytse Geast]] and [[De Himriksmole, Tytsjerk|De Himriksmole]])</small> and [[Wijnsermolen, Wyns|Wyns]] are home to mills. * The [[Burgumer Mar|Burgumer Lake]] * The Museum for [[Folklore]] in Earnewâld * The Skûtsje-Museum in Earnewâld * The Heimatmuseum with an [[Observatory]] in Burgum. ==External links== *{{commonscat-inline|Tietjerksteradeel}}
